intro: Linosyris nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright stem and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
